Hi Chad, now I see where the question came from.  I didn't realize you
were looking at objects that weren't just considered as "points."  

When looking at large contiguous objects, it no longer makes sense to
use radar-like sensors.  Rays are better for that kind of thing.  So
you send out several rays (at different angles) and see where they
intersect.  Generally radar sensors are better for point-like objects,
such as people.  The reason is that rays are likely to miss small
objects that don't span most of the arc.

I'm not sure if your idea for a vision system is really much different
from a bunch of ray and/or radar sensors.  It might just boil down to
the same information.  If not, maybe I am still misunderstanding a
bit.

ken
